intro: Lepicystis sepulta, commonly known as the slender bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and small, bladder-like structures called bladders, which are used to trap small aquatic organisms. The plant is typically found in slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and ditches. Its leaves are thin and ribbon-like, often appearing in pairs along the stems. Lepicystis sepulta plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microorganisms.
